title: Ticket #1530: needless spool path prepended to input files
description:
When input files are spooled, the schedd rewrites the input file list, the user log, the proxy, the executable, and the path to stdin. If these are basenames, it leaves them alone. Otherwise, it takes the basename and prepends the path to the spool directory. Since a basename is sufficient, there is no need to prepend the path to the spool.

This doesn't really cause any problem, but it makes the input file list difficult to read.
